data.question: What is the molecular weight of the gold cluster compound synthesized?
What type of crystal system does the synthesized gold cluster compound belong to?
What is the space group of the synthesized gold cluster compound?
What is the density (Dx) of the synthesized gold cluster compound?
What is the shortest Au-Au interatomic distance in the gold cluster compound?
What is the angle between Au2-Au1-Au6 in the gold cluster compound?
What method was used to solve the structure of the gold cluster compound?
What was the maximum shift in the final cycle of refinement for the gold cluster compound?
Were the methyl H atoms located in the structure determination of the gold cluster compound?
data.answer: No, methyl H atoms were not located.

data.question: What was the minimum relative transmission coefficient for the gold cluster compound?
Was the crystal size of the gold cluster compound larger than 0.1 mm in any dimension?
data.answer: No, the crystal size was 0.06 x 0.06 x 0.42 mm.

data.question: Did the synthesis of the gold cluster compound involve the use of a graphite monochromator?
data.answer: Yes, a graphite monochromator was used.

data.question: Is the gold cluster compound's crystal system hexagonal?
The space group for the gold cluster compound is P2_1/c.
The density of the gold cluster compound is less than 2 g cm^-3.
The shortest Au-Au interatomic distance in the compound is greater than 3 A.
The structure of the gold cluster compound was solved using Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy.
data.answer: False, it was solved by direct methods using MULTAN.

data.question: The gold cluster compound has a molecular weight of over 2000.
The gold cluster compound was synthesized at a temperature higher than 25°C.
The gold cluster compound's crystal size was measured to be exactly 0.06 x 0.06 x 0.42 mm.
